question_text: Which of the following are design considerations or risks associated with battery swelling in mobile devices? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Battery container prevents gas from escaping
Fire risk increases if battery is pierced
Battery should be used until fully discharged
correct_answer: Battery container prevents gas from escaping
Fire risk increases if battery is pierced
explanation: Swollen batteries are designed to contain gas, but can distort the device and pose fire hazards if punctured. Continued use is unsafe.
